column4: Greetings! My friend updated her ubuntu to the newest version and now she can't login to the desktop... everything work fine up to the login screen, after entering the password it looks like it is about to switch to desktop but then it goes back to the login screen.... You have any idea how to fix this?
so I'm not the only one?
you'l probably have to adjust you x settings but that will get you logged in.
yep, you're the 3rd today I've seen with that problem.
I don't see any file called .Xauthority in /home/$user/
I don't see any file called .Xauthority in /home/$user/
$user is the username of the account you can't get into.
.Xautority is a protected file yes. You'll need to use sudo rm to remove it
the only file you should need to touch, is the /home/username/.Xauthority file. Or follow what Tigerboy is suggesting :)
